title: 103_hr181
content: The "Notch Baby Act of 1993" is the short title of this legislation. It establishes a new guaranteed minimum primary insurance amount for individuals who become eligible during a transitional period. Section 215(a) of the Social Security Act is amended to include a new provision for individuals described in paragraph (4)(B) to have their primary insurance amount computed with an additional transitional increase amount. The Social Security Act is amended to include a provision for calculating the primary insurance amount with a transitional increase based on the individual's eligibility for old-age insurance benefits. The Social Security Act is amended to calculate the primary insurance amount with a transitional increase based on eligibility for old-age insurance benefits. The applicable percentage for benefits varies from 60 percent in 1979 to 10 percent in 1983. The term 'excess under former law' refers to the difference between the former law primary insurance amount and the individual's primary amount. The primary insurance amount is calculated with a transitional increase based on eligibility for old-age insurance benefits. The term 'applicable former law primary insurance amount' refers to the amount computed under specific conditions in December 1978. Subsection (b)(4) does not apply in determining this amount. The primary insurance amount calculation for individuals is based on specific conditions in December 1978, with certain provisions applying, such as the inclusion of calendar years after 1950 for computation base years. The primary insurance amount calculation for individuals is based on specific conditions in December 1978, with certain provisions applying. This paragraph applies if it results in a greater primary insurance amount for an individual compared to the calculation without this paragraph. SEC. 3. EFFECTIVE DATE AND RELATED RULES. The amendments made by this Act are effective as if they were part of the Social Security Amendments of 1977, with no benefit increases before January 1994. Recomputation of benefits is required for individuals entitled to monthly insurance benefits under title II of the Social Security Act for December 1987. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will recalculate the primary insurance amount for individuals entitled to monthly insurance benefits under the Social Security Act, taking into account the amendments made by the Act.
